column4: Someone help, please. I am running jaunty, and have installed the adobe-flashplugin and flashplugin-installer packages, but I still cannot play YouTube-videos - I simply get a black square where the video is supposed to be
does it show in about: plugins
yes it does
any ideas? It shows up in the plugin section so I guess it is installed correctly. Also, the flash  animation at http://www.adobe.com/products/flashplayer/ shows fine (albeit without sound)
are you running a 64bit ubuntu?
no I'm not
weird, 32bit is usually awesome with flash, you could download the tar.gz from www.adobe.com
and put the .so file in n~/.moziila/plugins
erhm... there is no plugins folder in ~/.mozilla
where did you go?
there is no ~/.mozilla/plugins folder
you need to make it: mkdir ~/.mozilla/plugins
damn that doesn't work either
thats how i always do it, the repo never works for me, its another way to tackle it
i know of it but i think they do the same deal. you could try: sudo apt-get --purge remove flashplayer-*; sudo apt-get --purge autoremove; sudo apt-get clean; sudo apt-get install flashplayer-nonfree
boot to live cd or root recovery mode and run fsck
and get a new drie. Make sure your backups are recent
how do I run fsck? Just Terminal -> 'fsck' ?
they are parts of the drive that are physically damaged
if you need drive speed then scsi can help. You need special hardware for scsi
